content:
• Wednesday, August 31, 2011
  • NOK

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) will be removed from the Stoxx Europe 50 index, effective September 19. Shares...

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) will be removed from the Stoxx Europe 50 index, effective September 19. Shares -2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM
  • ZUMZ

    Sports retailer Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) beats on a solid Q2, but lowers guidance for Q3, now saying...

    Sports retailer Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) beats on a solid Q2, but lowers guidance for Q3, now saying it will earn between $0.37 to $0.39 per share, below analysts expectations of $0.44. Shares -2.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM
  • XOMA

    XOMA (NASDAQ:XOMA) says its Chairman and CEO Steve Engle has resigned from his post effective...

    XOMA (NASDAQ:XOMA) says its Chairman and CEO Steve Engle has resigned from his post effective immediately, and appoints board member John Varian as the interim CEO. Shares -4.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • GEC

    Openwave (OPWV) finished up 30% on the day after filing suit against AAPL and RIMM. Wedbush...

    Openwave (OPWV) finished up 30% on the day after filing suit against AAPL and RIMM. Wedbush estimates Openwave's patent portfolio is worth roughly $100M, and speculates Google (NASDAQ:GOOG), which wasn't sued, could be in talks with the company. Even after today's rise, Openwave only has an enterprise value of about $66M.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • LDOS

    More on SAIC (SAI): Q2 misses across the board on a 6% Y/Y drop in revenue due to the winding...

    More on SAIC (SAI): Q2 misses across the board on a 6% Y/Y drop in revenue due to the winding down of government contracts and a lack of funding for new projects. Operating income was hit by higher interest expenses due to $750M of additional debt issued in 2010, plus the absence of royalty payments. Shares -7.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • LDOS

    SAIC (SAI): Q2 EPS of $0.32 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $2.6B (-5.5% Y/Y) misses by $0.2B ....

    SAIC (SAI): Q2 EPS of $0.32 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $2.6B (-5.5% Y/Y) misses by $0.2B . Expects FY12 Revenue at $10.6B-$11.0B, EPS from continuing operations $1.30-$1.40, Cash flow from continuing operations at or above $600M. Shares -5.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • JVA

    File under something doesn't add up: Coffee Holdings (NASDAQ:JVA) closes down 13% after the...

    File under something doesn't add up: Coffee Holdings (NASDAQ:JVA) closes down 13% after the company says its financials were leaked, helping cause volume yesterday to spike to 80% of outstanding shares. The stock is a new favorite of speculators, fitting in a way since 86% of the firm's first-half profits were earned on coffee options.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • GEF

    Greif, Inc. (NYSE:GEF): FQ3 EPS of $1.18 may not be comparable to estimates of $1.33. Revenue of...

    Greif, Inc. (NYSE:GEF): FQ3 EPS of $1.18 may not be comparable to estimates of $1.33. Revenue of $1.1B (+21% Y/Y). Sees FY11 EPS of $4.15-4.30 vs. estimates of $4.73. Shares -8.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • SGNT

    Sagent Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SGNT) receives FDA approval for its Orphenadrine Citrate...

    Sagent Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SGNT) receives FDA approval for its Orphenadrine Citrate Injection, USP, a skeletal muscle relaxant. Shares +0.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • S

    Sprint (S +6.1%) isn't the only service provider gaining on the DOJ's attempt to stop the...

    Sprint (S +6.1%) isn't the only service provider gaining on the DOJ's attempt to stop the AT&T/T-Mobile (NYSE:T) merger: Dish Network (DISH +6.3%) is moving higher as well. AT&T's partnership with DirecTV (DTV +0.7%) is likely the biggest factor behind the move, though Dish's plans to build a 4G network may also be playing a role.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • AMZN

    The latest Kindle (AMZN +1.8%) killer - this time from Sony (SNE -0.5%) - is light,...

    The latest Kindle (AMZN +1.8%) killer - this time from Sony (SNE -0.5%) - is light, easy-to-navigate and feature-rich, says a TechCrunch review. But will it unseat Amazon and Barnes and Noble's (BKS +1.8%) stranglehold on e-readers? Probably not, but the upgrade in design and form will keep the market percolating with innovation.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • AUO

    AU Optronics (NYSE:AUO) is up 4.6% on the day, as the company announces a business...

    AU Optronics (NYSE:AUO) is up 4.6% on the day, as the company announces a business restructuring, and the planned merger of Sony (NYSE:SNE), Hitachi (HIT), and Toshiba's display ops feeds hopes of lower capacity growth and stronger pricing for the LCD panel market. Fellow panel maker LG Display (LPL +1%) is clocking a more modest gain.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • OB

    OneBeacon Insurance (OB -1.8%) is down today after selling its AutoOne business to Interboro...

    OneBeacon Insurance (OB -1.8%) is down today after selling its AutoOne business to Interboro Holdings and forecasting a $28M charge against Q3 earnings to reflect its loss on the sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • FUN

    Cedar Fair (FUN +5.5%) pops after KeyBank analysts say shares look like a Buy after meeting with...

    Cedar Fair (FUN +5.5%) pops after KeyBank analysts say shares look like a Buy after meeting with incoming CEO Matt Ouimet. They set a price target of $25, noting they like the firm's strong management and see more families turning towards lower-end vacation destinations due to a weak economy.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • ROAN

    Shares of Berry Petroleum (BRY -2.5%) continue to drift lower in the afternoon session after...

    Shares of Berry Petroleum (BRY -2.5%) continue to drift lower in the afternoon session after Susquehanna cut the shares on valuation earlier today.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • BIDU

    The best way for Baidu (BIDU -3.5%) investors to guard against the risk of depleting market...

    The best way for Baidu (BIDU -3.5%) investors to guard against the risk of depleting market share is to also buy into SINA (SINA +1%), Susquehanna says. "Social media's impact will become more prominent in the next 18-24 months in China," and SINA, which runs Weibo, China's version of Twitter, "will become a significant competitor."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • MSL

    Regional bank stocks (KRE +2.2%) are up today after a round of not-so-terrible economic reports,...

    Regional bank stocks (KRE +2.2%) are up today after a round of not-so-terrible economic reports, although it won't be enough to wipe away August from going down as the sector's worst month in 18 months. Top gainers: BOP +6.9%, MSL +4.1%, HBHC +3.6%, ASBC +3.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • P

    Mashable reports Facebook will announce a new music service at its f8 developer conference on...

    Mashable reports Facebook will announce a new music service at its f8 developer conference on Sep. 22. Unlike many rival services, Facebook doesn't plan to host or stream music content, but instead will rely on offerings from startups Spotify, MOG, and Rdio. The news appears to be weighing on shares of Pandora (P -4.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • SMT

    SMART Technologies (SMT +8%) continues to move higher on better-than-average volume again today,...

    SMART Technologies (SMT +8%) continues to move higher on better-than-average volume again today, now up over 27% since the company announced its share buyback on August 19.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • QRVO

    TriQuint Semiconductor (TQNT -6.7%) is trading lower today after Barclays cut the shares to...

    TriQuint Semiconductor (TQNT -6.7%) is trading lower today after Barclays cut the shares to equalweight, saying the company's FQ4 guidance is too aggressive.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • NRG

    GenOn Energy (GEN +4.8%) gets a boost after Barclays maintains its Overweight rating and sets a...

    GenOn Energy (GEN +4.8%) gets a boost after Barclays maintains its Overweight rating and sets a $5 price target on shares. The firm may also benefit after it agrees to shut down one of its coal-fired plants in Virginia, but as a kicker gets to keep $32M sitting in escrow with a municipality for repairs.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • CGNX

    Cognex (NASDAQ:CGNX) falls 8.5% after the maker of industrial machine vision systems is cut to...

    Cognex (NASDAQ:CGNX) falls 8.5% after the maker of industrial machine vision systems is cut to Neutral by Piper's Auguste Richard, primarily on valuation concerns. Richard also thinks Cognex could have trouble meeting Street estimates, given its exposure to a weak chip equipment market, and recent softness in North America.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • MNST

    Shares of Hansen Natural (HANS -5.9%) fall after SEC filings show insider selling in the last...

    Shares of Hansen Natural (HANS -5.9%) fall after SEC filings show insider selling in the last week. Share are still up 10% over the last month and 61% for the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • RAMP

    Acxiom (ACXM +6.3%) is trading higher mid-day after announcing a $50M stock buyback earlier in...

    Acxiom (ACXM +6.3%) is trading higher mid-day after announcing a $50M stock buyback earlier in the session.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • T

    As AT&T (T -4.5%) plunges on news of the DOJ's lawsuit to halt the T-Mobile merger, the...

    As AT&T (T -4.5%) plunges on news of the DOJ's lawsuit to halt the T-Mobile merger, the company states it's "surprised and disappointed" by the move. Meanwhile, though the FCC hasn't made its own decision on the merger, Chairman Julius Genachowski suggests the agency "has serious concerns" about the deal's impact on competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 4 Comments
  • ETFC

    E-Trade (ETFC +7.2%) is the biggest gainer in the S&P 500 at midday, after Sandler...

    E-Trade (ETFC +7.2%) is the biggest gainer in the S&P 500 at midday, after Sandler O’Neill analysts say daily average revenue trades in the electronic retail investor market are up 40% M/M in August, bringing Q3 EPS upside of 4%-11% to e-brokers. Also: AMTD +3.2%, SCHW +1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • SEEL

    Apricus Bioscience (APRI +12%) pops after saying its subsidiary NexMed USA receives clearance...

    Apricus Bioscience (APRI +12%) pops after saying its subsidiary NexMed USA receives clearance from the FDA for its third OTC drug, Diphenhydramine-D, for the treatment of itching associated with insect bites, small cuts and other minor skin irritations.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • AMCX

    Shares of AMC Networks (AMCX +5.2%) move higher again, and are now up 16% over the last 5...

    Shares of AMC Networks (AMCX +5.2%) move higher again, and are now up 16% over the last 5 trading sessions as analyst upgrades and a potential buyout by a major media player weigh on investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • ADES

    Environmental technology firm ADA-ES (ADES +7.8%) pops after agreeing to pay a $40.5M settlement...

    Environmental technology firm ADA-ES (ADES +7.8%) pops after agreeing to pay a $40.5M settlement to Norit International N.V.'s Americas unit, ending a lawsuit filed by Norit over the theft of trade secrets.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • ZLC

    Zale Corp.'s (ZLC -13.8%) takes a hit after its FQ4 earnings showed a wider Y/Y loss, despite...

    Zale Corp.'s (ZLC -13.8%) takes a hit after its FQ4 earnings showed a wider Y/Y loss, despite better revenue, as soaring prices for precious metals and stones hit bottom line margins hard.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • CAR

    Zipcar (ZIP), whose shares had gradually declined following a stellar IPO, is up 6.1% after...

    Zipcar (ZIP), whose shares had gradually declined following a stellar IPO, is up 6.1% after announcing a partnership with Ford (NYSE:F) in which the latter will provide the former with 1,000 Focus sedans and Escape SUVs to Zipcar locations on 250 U.S. college campuses. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • P

    Shares of Pandora P show a little fear of heights after recapturing $14 earlier this week,...

    Shares of Pandora P show a little fear of heights after recapturing $14 earlier this week, falling 4.5% today. An item that may have captured the attention of investors is a recent report saying Spotify will post a profit for 2010 and is now up to 1.9M paying subscribers.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • RHT

    Red Hat (RHT +3.8%) moves higher this morning after Wells Fargo initiates coverage with an...

    Red Hat (RHT +3.8%) moves higher this morning after Wells Fargo initiates coverage with an outperform, saying the company has evolved into a broad-based provider of infrastructure stack solutions, and is well positioned to benefit from secular trends in open source TCO projects, virtualization and cloud management.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • TFM

    The Fresh Market (TFM +4.5%) gains after posting an earnings beat, reporting Q2 EPS of $0.22 vs...

    The Fresh Market (TFM +4.5%) gains after posting an earnings beat, reporting Q2 EPS of $0.22 vs consensus $0.18 on revenue of $260M (+14% Y/Y). The firm's FY11 outlook include 12-14 store openings, $85M-$90M in capital expenditures, same store sales at 4%-5% and an EPS range of $1.03-$1.06 - up from a previous estimate of $1.01-$1.05.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • LPSN

    LivePerson (LPSN +3.5%) is higher this morning after Wunderlich initiates it with a buy, noting...

    LivePerson (LPSN +3.5%) is higher this morning after Wunderlich initiates it with a buy, noting the company is a leading provider of chat-centric, SaaS-based sales and service solutions for online conversion and communications.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • ANDV

    Tesoro (TSO +3.8%) is up this morning after RBC raises it to outperform, saying it expects the...

    Tesoro (TSO +3.8%) is up this morning after RBC raises it to outperform, saying it expects the refiner to benefit from a high level of West Coast downtime for its competitors due to planned maintenance in October.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • CNQR

    Travel and expense management software firm Concur Technologies (NASDAQ:CNQR) is up 5.6% after...

    Travel and expense management software firm Concur Technologies (NASDAQ:CNQR) is up 5.6% after Wunderlich's Richard Baldry starts coverage with a Buy and $56 PT. Baldry touts Concur as a "sector dominator" worthy of a premium valuation, and also likes its "recurring and predictable" subscription-based revenue model. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • TZOO

    Travelzoo (TZOO +1.4%) briefly spikes and then falls back on apparently unfounded rumors of a...

    Travelzoo (TZOO +1.4%) briefly spikes and then falls back on apparently unfounded rumors of a deal with Facebook.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • OMN

    Specialty Chemical maker Omnova Solutions (OMN -14.4%) takes a hit this morning after cutting...

    Specialty Chemical maker Omnova Solutions (OMN -14.4%) takes a hit this morning after cutting its FY11 forecast due to higher commodity costs and weak global demand. It now expects EPS between $0.40 and $0.44, below previous estimates of $0.60.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • CTB

    Shares of Cooper Tire & Rubber (CTB +2.7%) and Goodyear Tire & Rubber (GT +4.2%) both...

    Shares of Cooper Tire & Rubber (CTB +2.7%) and Goodyear Tire & Rubber (GT +4.2%) both rally after the DOE awards the firms a $1.5M grant to study and evaluate fuel economy for the nation's fleet of cars. The tire makers aim to improve the weight and rolling resistance of tires enough to reach a 3% fuel efficiency improvement mark.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • SNDA

    Shanda Interactive (NASDAQ:SNDA) falls 5.8% after reporting Q2 revenue of $264.2M (+26% Y/Y) and...

    Shanda Interactive (NASDAQ:SNDA) falls 5.8% after reporting Q2 revenue of $264.2M (+26% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.18, missing consensus by $0.6M and $0.08. Gross margin fell 3.2% Q/Q, driven by a collapse in gross profit for businesses labeled under "Other revenues." One of these businesses is Shanda's Ku6 video site, which Deutsche Bank warned would hurt results.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • TKR

    Timken (TKR +7.4%) acquires Drives LLC, a maker of highly engineered drive chains and augers,...

    Timken (TKR +7.4%) acquires Drives LLC, a maker of highly engineered drive chains and augers, for $92m in cash, furthering its efforts to build up its power-transmission line of business.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • TIBX

    Shares of TIBCO Software (TIBX +4.4%) get a boost after last night's announcement it was buying...

    Shares of TIBCO Software (TIBX +4.4%) get a boost after last night's announcement it was buying Nimbus. One tech analyst writes on his blog that the deal should help the firm develop "business-engaged field sales capability."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • SEMG

    Energy services firm SemGroup (SEMG +7.6%) rises after announcing the sale of its SemStream...

    Energy services firm SemGroup (SEMG +7.6%) rises after announcing the sale of its SemStream natural gas unit to NGL Energy (NGL +2.8%) for $100M in cash, 8.95M NGL shares (current value of $188M), and a 7.5% interest in NGL's General Partner. SemGroup also has plans to float an IPO for its Rose Rock Midstream subsidiary.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) roars out of the gate early with a 4% gain, and has now moved 17% higher...

    Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) roars out of the gate early with a 4% gain, and has now moved 17% higher over the last 5 trading sessions. Zacks Investment sees even more upside, naming CAT as one of its 4 U.S. Companies Capitalizing on Emerging Market Growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 2 Comments
  • GCO

    Apparel retailer Genesco (NYSE:GCO) gains 9.8% after reporting FQ2 revenue of $470.6M (+29% Y/Y)...

    Apparel retailer Genesco (NYSE:GCO) gains 9.8% after reporting FQ2 revenue of $470.6M (+29% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.22, beating consensus $24.5M and $0.12. Same-store sales rose 14% Y/Y. The company now expects FY12 EPS of $3.35-$3.42, above a $3.30 consensus, on an expectation of 7-9% same-store sales growth. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • AMKR

    Amkor Technology (AMKR +3.5%) gains in early trading after announcing a $150M share buyback...

    Amkor Technology (AMKR +3.5%) gains in early trading after announcing a $150M share buyback representing nearly 20% of the company's current market capitalization.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • JVA

    Coffee Holdings (JVA -5.5%) falls after a leak forces the company to release financial...

    Coffee Holdings (JVA -5.5%) falls after a leak forces the company to release financial information to the public earlier than planned. In a 8-K filing with the SEC, the company says sales for the three months ending July 31 were $35.7M and costs were $33.6M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • GEC

    Openwave (OPWV) doesn't want to miss out on the wireless patent gold rush: the struggling mobile...

    Openwave (OPWV) doesn't want to miss out on the wireless patent gold rush: the struggling mobile software developer announces it's suing Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) and Research In Motion (RIMM) for allegedly infringing patents related to mobile e-mail and apps, among other features. Shares are up 17.7% on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • FCX

    Goldman Sachs says demand for metal should remain “fairly healthy,” driven by...

    Goldman Sachs says demand for metal should remain “fairly healthy,” driven by emerging markets, and the recent pullback in metals and mining stocks has created a “particularly attractive entry point for select names." Goldman reiterates Buy ratings on Freeport McMoran (FCX +3.3%) and Alcoa (AA +4.1%) following sharp pullbacks.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • JOY

    Joy Global (JOYG +5.6%) opens with a bounce after topping Q3 earnings views, and raising...

    Joy Global (JOYG +5.6%) opens with a bounce after topping Q3 earnings views, and raising full-year earnings and revenue guidance. The mining equipment maker also says it will sell its LeTourneau drilling operation to Cameron International (CAM +1%) for $375M. JOYG is in the process of buying China's International Mining Machinery Holdings.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • KERX

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) jumps 7.4% after announcing an independent agency has...

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) jumps 7.4% after announcing an independent agency has recommended the company's Phase 3 study of its Perifosine drug for treating Colorectal Cancer continue to completion. Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS), which has licensed Perifosine to Keryx, is up 2.5%. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • JOSB

    JoS. A. Bank Clothiers (NASDAQ:JOSB) knocks out a $0.06 earnings beat on $230M (+22% Y/Y) in Q2...

    JoS. A. Bank Clothiers (NASDAQ:JOSB) knocks out a $0.06 earnings beat on $230M (+22% Y/Y) in Q2 revenue. Same-store sales for August improved slightly compared to last year, even after Hurricane Irene eliminated a few shopping days. Shares +5.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • XCRA

    Shares of LTX-Credence (LTXC) fall 15% premarket after the firm reports in-line EPS and revenue...

    Shares of LTX-Credence (LTXC) fall 15% premarket after the firm reports in-line EPS and revenue for Q4, but warns of a tough Q1 in FY12 on weak semiconductor demand. The firm sees revenue falling to $35M-$39M, well-below the consensus estimate by analysts of $64M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • CTIC

    Premarket gainers: CTIC +18%. KERX +8%. FRO +5%. JOYG +5%. SINA +4%. UBS +3%. MPEL +3%. ARMH...

    Premarket gainers: CTIC +18%. KERX +8%. FRO +5%. JOYG +5%. SINA +4%. UBS +3%. MPEL +3%. ARMH +3%. JDSU +3%. MU +3%.
    Losers: LTXC -14%. DRYS -8%. NBG -7%. JVA -5%. TQNT -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
